main event: On 20 October 1958, an unidentified vapor trail was observed in Derby, Colorado, which was later determined to be a portion of a B-47 vapor trail.
interesting points: The observation lasted for about 2-3 minutes., The object was initially reported as a Red GOC., The sighting was classified under 'Ground-Visual' type of observation., A photographic slide showed a red dot which the observer had not noticed at the time of taking the picture., The red dot was later analyzed to be a perforation of emulsion in the slide.
witness description: No witnesses confirmed in the report.
